Song of the Moonlight Road

The Song of Waiting Under the Moon

0:00 0:00
History is not only the story of kings and battlesâ€”it is also the story of ordinary hearts. As Baekje grew powerful, trade flourished across the land. Merchants journeyed with ox-carts along dusty roads and sailed to distant shores. Yet every road meant someone left behind.

In those quiet villages, a different song roseâ€”not of armies or rulers, but of waiting wives. One such melody became known as the Song of the Moonlight Road.

They say a woman once stood under the moonlight, waiting for her husband who had gone to the market. She worked by day, but at night her heart ached with worry and longing.

And so, she sang to the moon:
